medical_history.chief_complaint: Back pain and a mass in the lung.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 17 days prior to admission with a sudden snap in the back while lifting something, followed by pain, profuse diaphoresis, and muscle spasms. The pain extended from the left shoulder to the buttocks, was rated between 6 and 8 on a scale of 1 to 10, worsened with deep inspiration, and caused difficulty in standing, breathing, and sleeping.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, chronic intermittent lower back pain after a fracture of the L1 vertebra from a sports-related injury 9 years earlier, multiple sports-related fractures, and allergies to penicillin, erythromycin, and tetracycline. The patient had exertional asthma treated with inhalers approximately 8 months before admission.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had gallstones; sister had mitral valve prolapse; niece had cerebral astrocytoma at age 5. Paternal grandmother and aunt had breast cancer; grandfather and aunt had throat cancer; uncle had esophageal cancer. Father and brother were healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Unmarried, works in sales, sexually active, drinks alcohol socially, does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
